rule: No circular dependencies allowed between modules

valid: Module A → Module B → Module C (acyclic dependency chain)
Module X depends on Module Y, Y depends on Z (no cycles)
invalid: Module A → Module B → Module A (circular dependency)
Module X → Y → Z → X (circular dependency chain)

metadata.description: Circular dependencies make code harder to understand, test, and maintain. They create tight coupling and make refactoring difficult.

rule: Application layer must not import from infrastructure layer directly

metadata.description: Layering ensures separation of concerns and maintainability. Each layer should only depend on layers below it.

rule: Public API endpoints must maintain backward compatibility

valid: Add new optional parameter to existing endpoint
Add new endpoint without modifying existing ones
Deprecate old endpoint while keeping it functional
invalid: Remove required parameter from existing endpoint
Change response schema for existing endpoint
Remove existing endpoint without deprecation period

metadata.description: API stability ensures clients don't break when we deploy updates. Breaking changes require major version bump.

rule: Exported TypeScript types must remain stable across versions

valid: Add new optional property to existing interface
invalid: Change property type in exported interface

metadata.description: Type stability ensures TypeScript consumers don't get compilation errors on updates.

rule: Constitutional files and directories must not be modified by agents without CS2 approval

valid: CS2 approval obtained before modifying BUILD_PHILOSOPHY.md
Agent reads but does not modify protected paths

metadata.description: Constitutional files define the foundation of the system. Changes require explicit human approval to prevent governance drift.

rule: All operations must respect CS1-CS6 constitutional safeguards

valid: CS1 (Immutability Guard) prevents constitutional file modification
CS2 (Architecture Approval) enforced for breaking changes
invalid: Bypass CS1 to modify workflow files
Skip CS2 approval for protected file changes

metadata.description: CS1-CS6 are constitutional safeguards that ensure system integrity. They cannot be bypassed or weakened.

rule: 100% QA passing is absolute - no exceptions for partial passes

valid: QA is 100% green with zero warnings → Proceed
Build blocked until failing test is fixed
invalid: Ignore one failing test as 'not important' (FORBIDDEN)
Whitelist failing test to pass QA (FORBIDDEN)

metadata.description: Partial QA passes (301/303) are total failures. Quality is absolute, not contextual.
